content:
Dear Steve,

I hope this message finds you well. I received your offer to nominate me as the next 401k committee chairperson, and while I am flattered by your confidence in me, I must respectfully decline.

To be frank, I fear that I may not be the best fit for this position at this time. While I have experience with retirement savings plans, I must admit that I am not familiar with ESRI compliance, the topic that you mentioned during our conversation. As you may know, ESRI is a company that provides software and services for geographic information systems (GIS) and mapping technology, and it seems to be unrelated to the 401k retirement savings plan.

I suspect that you may have been thinking of FINRA compliance instead, which refers to the regulations that govern the financial industry. While I do have some experience with FINRA compliance, I do not feel confident in my ability to lead the committee without a solid understanding of the responsibilities and requirements involved with ESRI compliance.

Again, thank you for your consideration, and I hope that you will find someone more qualified and knowledgeable to serve as the next 401k committee chairperson.

Best regards,

[Your Name]
